name: v0.12.0
body:
# Update set of available CUE toolchain versions

Introduce [version 0.12.1](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.12.1), establishing it as the new default. In order to keep the set of available toolchain versions manageable, remove versions [0.10.0](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.10.0) and [0.10.1](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.10.1).

Also test against a fresher set of Bazel versions. Drop support for testing against Bazel at version 6, and start testing against version 8.

While here, freshen the version of Bazel used in this repository, as well as the version of the Go SDK used to build the _replace-stamps_ program.

# Details
## Using modules with Bazel 6 and later

1. Enable support for modules in your _.bazelrc_ file by adding the following line:
  `common --enable_bzlmod`
1. Add the following directive to your _MODULE.bazel_ file:
```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_cue", version = "0.12.0")
```


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/compare/v0.11.0...v0.12.0

name: v0.10.0

# Update set of available CUE toolchain versions

Introduce [version 0.11.2](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.11.2), establishing it as the new default, as well as making the prior [version 0.11.1](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.11.1) available too. In order to keep the set of available toolchain versions manageable, remove version 0.8.2.

name: v0.8.1
body:
# Restore WORKSPACE.bazel file for Bazel 6 support

In order to accommodate users with Bazel version 6, we must retain the _WORKSPACE.bazel_ file, even though it's no longer required to be present in Bazel 7.

Note that the Bazel Central Registry (BCR) CI workflow tests with both Bazel version 6 and 7 per the "bazel" matrix entries in the _.bcr/presubmit.yml_ file.

# Details
## Using modules with Bazel 6 and later

1. Enable support for modules in your _.bazelrc_ file by adding the following line:
  `common --enable_bzlmod`
1. Add the following directive to your _MODULE.bazel_ file:
```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_cue", version = "0.8.1")
```


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/compare/v0.8.0...v0.8.1

name: v0.8.0
body:
# Update set of available CUE toolchain versions

Introduce [version 0.10.0](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.10.0), establishing it as the new default, removing the prior versions [0.9.0](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.9.0), [0.9.1](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.9.1), and [0.9.2](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.9.2), as none of them could accommodate symbolic links within imported modules that most of Bazel's sandboxing strategies require.

Pertinent URLs to related discussion:
- [Thread in the "modules" channel of the "CUE" Slack workspace](https://cuelang.slack.com/archives/C063DSMKS56/p1720620420965109)
- cue-lang/cue#3300

# Details
## Using modules with Bazel 6 and later

1. Enable support for modules in your _.bazelrc_ file by adding the following line:
  `common --enable_bzlmod`
1. Add the following directive to your _MODULE.bazel_ file:
```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_cue", version = "0.8.0")
```


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/compare/v0.7.0...v0.8.0

name: v0.6.0
body:
# Update set of available CUE toolchain versions

Introduce [version 0.8.0](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.8.0), establishing it as the new default, as well as making the prior [version 0.7.1](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.7.1) available too. In order to keep the set of available toolchain versions manageable, remove [version 0.5.0](https://github.com/cue-lang/cue/releases/tag/v0.5.0).

In order to accommodate new behavior in version 0.8.0, introduce the "output_package_name" attribute.

Per [CUE CL 1177546](https://review.gerrithub.io/c/cue-lang/cue/+/1177546), allow use of the CUE tool's broadened interpretation of the `--package` command-line flag, introducing the "output_package_name" attribute on the `cue_consolidated_*` and `cue_exported_*` macros to designate into which CUE package to generate CUE code, when the "output_format" attribute's value is "cue".

With this new "output_package_name" attribute available, deprecate the former "non_cue_file_package_name" attribute, intending to remove it entirely in a subsequent release.

Allow generating CUE code with the `cue_exported_*` macros.

# Details
## Using modules with Bazel 6 and later

1. Enable support for modules in your _.bazelrc_ file by adding the following line:
  `common --enable_bzlmod`
1. Add the following directive to your _MODULE.bazel_ file:
```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_cue", version = "0.6.0")
```


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/compare/v0.5.0...v0.6.0

default.

# Details
## Using modules with Bazel 6 and later



## What's Changed
* Ensure that annotated tag content is available by @seh in https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/pull/6
* Update set of available CUE toolchain versions by @seh in https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/pull/7


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/compare/v0.4.0...v0.4.1

name: v0.3.0
body:
Mandate use of [Bazel version 6.1.0](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/6.1.0) to rely on bazelbuild/bazel#17279 being available, having removed our local workaround for that problem.

Commits since last release: [_v0.2.2...v0.3.0_](https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/compare/v0.2.2...v0.3.0)

name: v0.2.2
body:
Propagate tags from top-level rule-wrapping macro invocations to intermediate targets.

Commits since last release: [_v0.2.1...v0.2.2_](https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/compare/v0.2.1...v0.2.2)

name: v0.2.1
body:
Upgrade [Gazelle to version 0.29.0](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-gazelle/releases/tag/v0.29.0), and update the _go.mod_ file to require Go version 1.17 at minimum in order to [maintain compatibility with Gazelle](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-gazelle/blob/1ca72fdef279b2a7b0fbef22572aece1380361a9/internal/bzlmod/go_mod.bzl#L6-L9).

Commits since last release: [_v0.2.0...v0.2.1_](https://github.com/seh/rules_cue/compare/v0.2.0...v0.2.1)
